content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the code for the function `clean_column` in Julia:
```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    cleaned = lowercase(replace(col, r"\s|-" => "_"))
    return strip(cleaned)
end
```
This function takes an input string (`col`) and returns a cleaned version of the column name. The `lowercase` function is used to convert all letters in the input string to lowercase. The `replace` function is used to replace any spaces or hyphens with underscores. Finally, the `strip` function removes any leading or trailing whitespaces from the resulting string.
